Where in their vision is the King who stood out against the Vietnam War, who pledged to organise a poor people's march on Washington and who mounted a devastating critique of capitalism?
What about the King who talked of revolution and who the FBI labelled "the most dangerous Negro in America"? Where is the King who was gunned down in Memphis while supporting striking workers? Author & journalist Yuri Prasad will be discussing King's radical legacy.
